Detailed Description

Information about an event on a MD.

Definition at line 549 of file types.h.

Field Documentation

__u64 lnet_event_t::hdr_data

64 bits of out-of-band user data.

Only valid for LNET_EVENT_PUT.

See also:
LNetPut

Definition at line 591 of file types.h.

lnet_process_id_t lnet_event_t::initiator

The identifier (nid, pid) of the initiator.

Definition at line 553 of file types.h.

__u64 lnet_event_t::match_bits

A copy of the match bits specified in the request.

Definition at line 565 of file types.h.

lnet_md_t lnet_event_t::md

A snapshot of the state of the MD immediately after the event has been processed.

In particular, the threshold field in md will reflect the value of the threshold after the operation occurred.

Definition at line 586 of file types.h.

Referenced by request_out_callback().

lnet_handle_md_t lnet_event_t::md_handle

The handle to the MD associated with the event.

The handle may be invalid if the MD has been unlinked.

Definition at line 580 of file types.h.

unsigned int lnet_event_t::mlength

The length (in bytes) of the data that was manipulated by the operation.

For truncated operations, the manipulated length will be the number of bytes specified by the MD (possibly with an offset, see lnet_md_t). For all other operations, the manipulated length will be the length of the requested operation, i.e. rlength.

Definition at line 575 of file types.h.

unsigned int lnet_event_t::offset

The displacement (in bytes) into the memory region that the operation used.

The offset can be determined by the operation for a remote managed MD or by the local MD.

See also:
lnet_md_t::options

Definition at line 610 of file types.h.

unsigned int lnet_event_t::rlength

The length (in bytes) specified in the request.

Definition at line 567 of file types.h.

lnet_nid_t lnet_event_t::sender

The NID of the immediate sender.

If the request has been forwarded by routers, this is the NID of the last hop; otherwise it's the same as the initiator.

Definition at line 559 of file types.h.

volatile lnet_seq_t lnet_event_t::sequence

The sequence number for this event.

Sequence numbers are unique to each event.

Definition at line 615 of file types.h.

int lnet_event_t::status

Indicates the completion status of the operation.

It's 0 for successful operations, otherwise it's an error code.

Definition at line 596 of file types.h.

Referenced by request_out_callback().

lnet_process_id_t lnet_event_t::target

The identifier (nid, pid) of the target.

Definition at line 551 of file types.h.

lnet_event_kind_t lnet_event_t::type

Indicates the type of the event.

Definition at line 561 of file types.h.

Referenced by request_out_callback().

int lnet_event_t::unlinked

Indicates whether the MD has been unlinked.

Note that:

  • An event with unlinked set is the last event on the MD.
  • This field is also set for an explicit LNET_EVENT_UNLINK event.
    See also:
    LNetMDUnlink

Definition at line 603 of file types.h.
